docstring: PyEED is a Python-encoded data model of an Enzyme Engineering Database. It supports the scalable and reproducible analysis of sequence and structure data of protein families, and makes data and processes findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable according to the FAIR data principles.

amino_acid_sequence.description: The amino acid sequence of the protein sequence object.

nr_id.description: Identifier for the NCBI NR database

ncbi_taxonomy_id.description: NCBI Taxonomy ID to identify the organism

start_position.description: Position in the sequence where the domain starts

end_position.description: Position in the sequence where the domain ends

reference_position.description: Equivalent position in the reference sequence

sequence_position.description: Position that is equivalent to the reference sequence position that is also given

start_position.description: Start position of the annotation. A single start position without an end corresponds to a single amino acid

end_position.description: Optional end position if the annoation contains more than a single amino acid.

function.description: Function that is found in the annotated amino acid or sub-sequence

protein_sequence_id.description: Reference to the corresponding protein sequence to which this DNA sequence translates
